pkgmetadata.longdescription: =================================PyRecord: Pythonic *Record* Types=================================A `record <http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Record_(computer_science)>`_ (aka"struct" in C) is a pre-defined collection of values where each is accessedby a unique name. Depending on the nature of the data, records may be asuperior alternative to dictionaries and instances of custom classes.**PyRecord** allows you to use records in CPython v2.7, CPython v3.3+, PyPyand PyPy v3, and can be thought of as an improved *namedtuple*.The documentation is available at https://pythonhosted.org/pyrecord/.. image:: https://img.shields.io/travis/gnarea/pyrecord.svg :target: https://travis-ci.org/gnarea/pyrecord :alt: Build Status.. image:: https://img.shields.io/coveralls/gnarea/pyrecord/master.svg :target: https://coveralls.io/r/gnarea/pyrecord?branch=master :alt: Coverage Status.. image:: https://img.shields.io/pypi/dm/pyrecord.svg :target: https://pypi.python.org/pypi/pyrecord/ :alt: Downloads
